Last update: 20-05-2023

## Information Theory, Geometry and Statistics for Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) Data

### Installation

``` r
# Installation
install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("XXX/SITSAR")
```

``` r
install.packages("SITSAR_0.0.0.9000.tar.gz", repos = NULL, type = "source")
```

### Use

``` r
# package import
library(SITSAR)
```

### Example

``` r

library(SITSAR)

set.seed(1) # determining a seed
alpha <- -1.5
gama <- 2
L <- 8
Xobs<- rg0i(100,alpha, gama, L)
Xobs
#>   [1]  1.8453579 14.7488112  1.5477842  2.3384974  6.5861106  3.1673982
#>   [7]  4.1567825  1.4293145 28.8300946  5.0184056  2.0421880  5.2473748
#>  [13]  1.9539546  1.2284584  3.5296346  3.9032888  6.7362028  0.5863480
#>  [19]  1.8933199  0.2399998  2.4681358  9.3941818  1.8747479  0.6941743
#>  [25]  3.6132150  2.7341462  0.9907654  1.3547218  0.7725113  0.8244600
#>  [31]  1.4691030  4.5853825 21.3045413  6.4141640  0.4904419  1.2927017
#>  [37]  0.6342322  2.6376727  1.0652601  0.3847437  0.7318324  1.3196877
#>  [43]  1.2960815  0.6831986  6.1007277  0.7309920  2.3241084  1.2365888
#>  [49]  4.6440500  1.0845936  0.5273525  6.3971916  4.2381987  5.2909314
```

``` r

dg0i(Xobs,alpha, gama, L)
#>   [1] 0.2158533336 0.0034064866 0.2700931685 0.1521080903 0.0210505968
```

``` r

library(SITSAR)

set.seed(1) # determining a seed
alpha <- -1.5
gama <- 2
L <- 8
Xobs2<- rg0i(100,alpha,gama,L)
estimatorg0i(c(alpha,gama,L), Xobs2)
#> [1] -1.328314  1.916167 20.915136
estimatorg0i(c(-1.1,1,1),Xobs2)
#> [1] -1.335928  1.938989 18.370732
```

``` r

set.seed(1) # determining a seed
alpha <- -1.5
gama <- 2
L <- 8
distancesg0i(c(alpha,gama,L),c(alpha,gama,L))
#> 
#> Distance Calculation Summary
#> 
#> Type:
#> [1] "KL"
#> Distance:
#> [1] 0
res <- distancesg0i(c(alpha,gama,L),c(alpha,gama,4))
print(res)
#> 
#> Distance Calculation Summary
#> 
#> Type:
#> [1] "KL"
#> Distance:
#> [1] 0.02876791
```

``` r

library(SITSAR)

set.seed(1) # determining a seed
data("SanFrancisco150")
image <- SanFrancisco150
# left,right, up,down)
marks1 <- c(10,30,50,100)
marks2 <- c(20,50,80,130)
teste <- distancesg0itable(image,marks1, marks2, p = 1/2)
#> Calculating the distances.....................
teste
#> 
#> Distances Table
#> 
#>          KL     Renyi Bhattacharyya Hellinger Arithmetic-Geometric Triangular
#> HH 4.287151 0.7597351     0.3798676 0.3160480            1.6208536  0.8484721
#> HV 3.437277 0.8828999     0.4414499 0.3568967            1.0910689  1.0532641
#> VV 1.338417 0.3452340     0.1726170 0.1585401            0.3672193  0.5544557
#>    Harmonic-Mean
#> HH     0.5520576
#> HV     0.7478823
#> VV     0.3246612
```
